title: January 8-27, 2026
summary: Kling 01 Elements emerges as breakthrough workflow with micro-LoRAs and 6-image control, LTX Audio-to-Video launches with powerful lip-sync capabilities, Runway 4.5 I2V shows dramatic physics improvements, Veo 3.1 Flow features leak including outpainting and camera control, DorLabs announces massive update with grid workflows and character toggles, Topaz upscaling best practices shared (Proteus, Iris, Astra), Freepik NBP experiences widespread slowness, X launches Creator Program with $500K funding, Hat Trick Productions showcases UK TV industry AI adoption, and community welcomes Tom Furse, Jeremy Boxer, and James McAulay.
keyHighlights: Kling 01 Elements workflow breakthrough with micro-LoRAs and 6-image scene control
LTX Audio-to-Video launches with powerful lip-sync and camera movement
Runway 4.5 I2V demonstrates dramatically improved running physics and multi-shot sequences
Veo 3.1 Flow features leak: outpainting, camera control, and advanced capabilities
DorLabs announces major update with grid extraction, character toggles, and 80% faster workflows
X Creator Program launches with $500K total funding for 5 creators

items.title: üéÆ Kling 01 Elements - Breakthrough Workflow
items.description: Jordan Daniel Chesney declared Kling 01 "100% the new way to work," calling it "the biggest breakthrough since NB." The Elements feature allows building multiple micro-LoRAs (4 images per LoRA) plus up to 6 image ingredients for total scene control. Jordan emphasized: "Coupled with NBP, you can now block exactly where the camera goes, exactly what multiple subjects do, where they stand, how they act, and control the hundreds of details within your room/scene, with total consistency." He's now using upwards of 30 images to create a single shot. Billy Boman agreed it's "truly unmatched" for getting specific scenes, characters, products with dynamic camera in one seamless 10-second clip, noting it's more "intelligent" than Veo ingredients currently. Martin LeBlanc and Edmond Yang also confirmed this as the breakthrough workflow. Main drawback: morphing and artifacts on dynamic whip pans and transitions.

items.title: üé§ LTX Audio-to-Video Launch
items.description: Jordan Daniel Chesney announced "Here it is... Audio to video" and called it powerful for lip-sync when you have specific audio. Linus Ekenstam confirmed "LTX is really powerful." PJ Accetturo asked about best lip-sync options, noting the problem that most models have completely static cameras. PJ explained "it's why Veo remained king for so long - the moving camera helped get past the uncanny speaking." Edmond Yang noted Kling's lip-sync on videos is "pretty decent." Ari kuschnir used it for a music video remake, combining it with Kling Motion Control and Runway 4.5. Some users reported crashes.

items.title: üèÉ Runway 4.5 I2V - Dramatic Physics Improvements
items.description: Marco shared extensive Runway 4.5 I2V tests showcasing dramatically improved running physics and multi-shot sequences. Jordan Daniel Chesney responded: "So cool. Wow. Their running physics have dramatically improved." The tests demonstrated better motion quality and the ability to handle complex action sequences. Marco noted the main remaining challenge: "I just need a video model to NOT fuck up logos now." Jordan shared his solution: "I do FIRST frame and LAST frame to hold logos together. With the logos consistent together in both frames Kling does an amazing job of holding them together throughout."

items.title: üé¨ Veo 3.1 Flow Features Leak
items.description: Pierre Zandrowicz discovered unreleased features on Veo's website including camera control and outpainting. Chris First caught the leak, noting "Must be an early whoopsie" and "The prompt even is like the description lol not the actual prompt." Screenshots showed advanced camera control options and outpainting capabilities. Ryan Phillips noted these features were "talked about when it was used for the Aronofsky short a while back but is yet to be available to the wider users." Billy Boman asked if it's live in Flow, but Ryan confirmed "I don't believe so... yet." Issa Sissoko and others couldn't see it in their accounts, suggesting region-specific rollout.

items.title: üé® DorLabs Major Update Announcement
items.description: Yonatan Dor brothers announced a "gigantic patch to DorLabs next week" that "basically allows me to create films 80% faster." Key features include: grid creation based on image refs with prompt suggestions, panel extraction with upscale and optional modification in one step, character and location toggles at any step, script feeding, ref image input, and one-sentence prompting. He demonstrated the grid extraction feature, which "doesn't only let you extract, it lets you also create grids based on image refs, get prompt suggestions based on your input, then extract any panel + upscale & optional modification." Edmond Yang joked about the marketing, and Yonatan responded "I built it for myself first and foremost, so it's true." Multiple members including Billy Boman, MetaPuppet, Max, and Edmond Yang requested early access. The update is launching in Europe as well.

items.title: üîç Topaz Upscaling Best Practices
items.description: Martin LeBlanc asked about Topaz video upscaling model preferences. Ryan Phillips recommended "Iris for close ups." Billy Boman detailed his Proteus workflow: "Proteus for all-around use. Recovery detail to zero. Change from automatic to manual analysis for clips and then hit estimate - zero sharpen and improve detail." Martin LeBlanc agreed "Proteus seems like the best overall." For Astra, Billy Boman noted a new model launched late last year "more tuned for realism which I haven't really played with yet." Andy Mc said "Astra's fun to play with and produces good results but too slow and needs better granular controls to fine tune the output." Edmond Yang shared: "I like Astra, for closeups it's pretty good, but hallucinates with small objects, I tend to crop in and upscale and put back again. And also would need to upscale clip by clip, since there's some ghosting between shots, at least 1-2 frames." Adrian confirmed "the ghosting sucks hard yeah. upscaling just isn't there yet for whatever reason." Jordan Daniel Chesney recommended: "Use Topaz Astra Precise to re-generate in upscale. I've found that it works wonders. As long as you can roto sections, like characters faces, then this workflow saves 50% of the low quality motion artifacts." He also shared his vision for Topaz to add "SMART ROTO/COMPOSITION" with multiple masks and automatic comping: "1 level of generative upscale for the backgrounds, 1 for the elements/logos, and 1 for faces. I'd pay $100 a clip if this was available."

items.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Freepik NBP Widespread Slowness
items.description: Multiple community members reported severe slowness with Nano Banana Pro across platforms. Albert Bozesan experienced issues on enterprise unlimited, calling it "crazy slow" and requesting others like his message to send collective feedback. He explained: "Because they opened up unlimited access to a ton more accounts without sorting priority. I assume all users are dumped into the same waitlist." üë®üèª‚Äçüé® reported NBP sluggishness for 2-3 days and couldn't generate ANY NBP images even on Ultra Google Flow account. Luka T joked "Nano banana Pro obviously switched to SD 1.4 engine" with a poor quality example. Billy Boman noted the workaround is "Cinematic Live Action prompting" + references, but "absolutely sometimes it goes into old Imagen vibes in the worst way." Jordan Daniel Chesney demonstrated Freepik's new Split Grid button, and Seb Ungrad humorously showed it generating actual grid patterns. Billy Boman noted "Freepik (unlimited) is unfortunately almost always slow" while Albert Bozesan said credits shouldn't be slow. Edmond Yang reported "Runway has been good for me with NBP." Batuhan Bintas suggested "HailouAI / Minimax is great for Nano banana."

items.title: üí∞ X Creator Program - $500K Funding
items.description: PJ Accetturo shared news about X Originals offering funding. Matty clarified "Looks like it's $100K for 5 Creators $500K total." Rourke revealed extensive Dubai opportunities: "Creators HQ are going nuts, they've already recruited me to relocate to Dubai. They're trying to move something like 5000 creators a year to Dubai, investing super heavy into AI companies atm, the government is giving significant benefits if they set up offices there." He detailed: "First of all, no income tax and 9% corporation tax, so basically 2x payday anyway, but depending on how big your company is, they bracket you into tiers and give you priority on big 'government' contracts (the government owns 50% of the businesses + economy out there basically)." KƒìkƒÅ proposed: "How many dreamers can rally, form a collective, pool resources and find interesting ways to collab and start an inner-city on the back of Dubai..." Edmond Yang clarified the program structure: "So... we submit the idea, top 5 gets 100k to make the idea come to life, and they choose top 3?"

items.title: üé¨ Hat Trick Productions - UK TV Industry AI Adoption
items.description: Liam announced a "Huge moment for Hat Trick Productions incoming" with a BTS documentary showcasing AI adoption by a major UK legacy TV/Film player. He emphasized: "The films themselves can't be shown (it was closed-door) but I'm super proud of this BTS documentary and I think it's a big moment in the UK TV/Film industry demonstrating adoption by a major legacy player. This doc is deliberately honest about creativity with AI - the good and the not so good." Yigit responded "Love it Liam! Beautifully shot and edited." Ryan Phillips noted: "I remember hearing about this on the grapevine and being proper jealous! Hat trick are a great company to have as a partner pushing AI forward."

items.title: üé• Lily Wins 1 Billion Summit AI Film Award
items.description: Chris First announced from Dubai: "Time for the announcement of the 1,000,000 prize here in Dubai! Lily won." David Clark stated "The right film won in my opinion. Out of what was left in the top 5." Billy Boman countered: "It's just the wrong top 5. Compared to so many pieces made by the collective genius here in this group - all finalists were mediocre imo." Minh called it "a banger film." The community joked about taxes and creating an alternative ceremony, with Martin LeBlanc proposing "Realdreams taxes" and Edmond Yang noting "we love taxes in norway too."

items.title: üé® Reve References Feature
items.description: Billy Boman shared the announcement of Reve's new References feature, continuing the platform's rapid development and feature additions.

items.title: üé¨ Runway AI Summit with Kathleen Kennedy
items.description: Billy Boman shared: "Kathleen Kennedy of Lucasfilm speaking on Runways AI summit - this year we're going mainstream!" The announcement signals major Hollywood adoption of AI tools.

items.title: üé¨ Kling 01 Elements Workflow Deep Dive
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney provides comprehensive breakdown of the breakthrough workflow.
items.description: Jordan explained the workflow: "Go to Kling 01, Select 'Elements', Build your micro-LoRAs (Elements) = 4 images per LoRA, Add images (up to 6), Then reference your elements (LoRAs) and images with @ references, Choose between 3-10 seconds (1080p)." He emphasized: "It's not a START and END frame kind of tool. Give it 4 images for the shot, plus this woman as a Character Element (lora). Maybe even the cars are Elements too. I'm using upwards to 30 images now to create 1 shot. The more images you feed the better." Luka T asked about having multiple people in a shot with only one speaking/moving. Edmond Yang recommended: "Isolate and combine in post" or use Kling lip-sync where "you can actually choose who is speaking." Jordan suggested: "Use Kling 01 for this. Create multiple micro LoRAs of each person (as Elements) and then upload up to 6 images for your scene blocking." Ryan Phillips wished for "more aspect ratios."

items.title: üé® Nano Banana Pro Grid Strategy
items.overview: Martin LeBlanc and Billy Boman discuss the famous 3x3 grid workflow.
items.description: Billy Boman asked: "Anyone got some fav prompt formulas down for the famous 3x3 Nano Grid strategy?" Martin LeBlanc shared they have it "baked into the UI" and revealed their prompt: "Generate a cohesive 3√ó3 grid 'Cinematic Contact Sheet' featuring 9 distinct camera shots of exactly these subjects in the same environment. You must adapt the standard cinematic shot types to fit the content (e.g., if a group, keep the group together; if an object, frame the whole object): [List each shot here]" He also shared a detailed LLM prompt for extracting and enhancing individual panels: "You are given a storyboard contact sheet: one grid image with multiple panels. Task: Create a prompt for isolate and enhance only the panel mentioned... Hard constraints: Do not change the composition, framing, camera angle, or perspective. Do not add, remove, or modify any characters, props, objects, or background elements..." James McAulay tested it successfully but noted "the camera angles could be more distinct." Edmond Yang suggested "Probably better in 16:9 instead of 1:1, so you get more closer to the final shot. Sometimes I prompt it to do very different camera angles just for exploring." Gabe Michael created a similar Space for b-roll "that does a similar thing but without losing quality on the grid."

items.title: üé¨ Logo Consistency Technique
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney shares critical technique for maintaining logo integrity.
items.description: Marco lamented: "I just need a video model to NOT fuck up logos now... lol" Jordan responded with his solution: "I do FIRST frame and LAST frame to hold logos together. With the logos consistent together in both frames Kling does an amazing job of holding them together throughout." Marco agreed: "yeah, fair point - just hate how if u don't do that they go to shit!" Jordan confirmed: "I know right. Tell me bout it. Did a few fashion commercials and we had to do FIRST and LAST frame for every single shot, no exceptions."

items.title: üì∏ Camera & Lens Prompting from IMDb
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney shares pro technique for authentic cinematography.
items.description: Jordan shared: "If you're ever looking for camera and lens prompts to capture that perfect look, go to: IMDb, Search for a film that had the look you love, check the Tech Specs. Lots of the time, lenses, film stock, cameras etc. are listed out. This is the tech specs for Taxi Driver, one of my favorite looks." Yonatan Dor brothers asked which movie, and Jordan confirmed "Taxi Driver."

items.title: üé¨ Timelapse Clock Challenge
items.overview: Henry seeks solutions for the "holy grail" of clock timelapses.
items.description: Henry asked: "Cheeky question: does anyone know a model which can properly do the timelapse of a clock? Closer I got from testing a bunch of models is VEO but it seems like hands of a clock is still the holy grail of genAI. Any success doing this?" Justin Hackney suggested: "Have you tried hyperlapse as well as Timelapse etc for prompting? We had something like this and was a bit of a nightmare. Needed up doing a bunch of frame to frame + single image generations, reducing the frame rate etc." Rory Flynn offered: "I actually had success on WAN2.6 with this..also Kling keyframes in 01" and recommended "using a keyframe that has like the radial blur of the Timelapse effect as the end frame." Henry ultimately decided: "I might end up having to just After Effect it."

items.title: üé® Model Preferences Discussion
items.overview: Martin LeBlanc surveys the community on most-used models.
items.description: Martin LeBlanc asked for a prompting guide: "I'm putting together a prompting guide - a PDF with all kinds of useful tips/tricks and prompt examples for the most popular models... which models are you guys relying the most on at the moment?" His proposed list: NBP, Seedream 4.5, Kling o1, Kling 2.6, Kling 2.6 MoCo, Veo 3.1, Seedance 1.5, Sora. Edmond Yang confirmed: "NBP, all klings." Sebastian Kamph represented the open source perspective: "I use Wan for most of my professional work, as I primarily build custom pipelines for shots that can't be solved by any of the closed source models. For stills, it's zimage, qwen, flux (also wan, even though it's a video model)." He specified "2.2 primarily. 2.5 and 2.6 are only api" and noted "I'm probably in the minority in this particular group."

items.title: üé¨ Open Source vs Closed Source Debate
items.overview: Noah advocates for local open source reliability.
items.description: During Freepik outages, Noah declared: "I will bang on the open source local drum for my entire life just because I don't trust aws or Facebook to keep the internet on." Billy Boman challenged: "Any open source equivalent of Nano Pro? I sure haven't found one so far (Flux isn't even close in prompt adherence and keeping styles etc)." Edmond Yang suggested "Flux 2 klein?" Noah responded: "Klien or Qwen. Nano is a miracle for sure and you'll need to be a little more patient with the other tools but the safety of being sequestered in your own controlled garden is worth it." Luka T noted: "It's great edit model but getting 2 or even 4K (without upscaling hence destroying consistency to an extent) is a hustle, NBP is still the best." Noah agreed: "Oh 100% nano is better. It's just stuck with google's 'ethics' and 'morals' and 'don't make images of people with no skin' nonsense."

items.title: üé® T-Pose and Y-Pose for Action Shots
items.overview: Blvckl!ght shares technique for dynamic action composition.
items.description: Blvckl!ght revealed: "I use 'T pose' and 'Y pose, helps with action shots. Also 'add motion blur' for mid-action shots (super useful for all the wides bc then you can in-paint other parts of the scene." This technique helps with character positioning and dynamic scene composition.

items.title: üé¨ Pika Status Questions
items.overview: Community discusses Pika's current state and direction.
items.description: Matthieu asked "was just wondering if pika is still alive." Harvey inquired: "Whats the pika scoop?" KevinShah/CreativeAIgency clarified: "Leonie is at xAI." Blvckl!ght explained: "They jumped the shark when they bailed on everything to do UGC and their own ugc platform. Sora 2 launch nuked that immediately and they haven't recovered since." Leonie responded with "say more pls" and Harvey asked: "I saw their socials hadn't been very active and someone mentioned a buy out, are you still with them?" Andy Mc noted: "Comfy don't appear to support it via API anymore - ditto Freepik."

items.title: üé¨ AI vs Traditional Production Discussion
items.overview: Community debates whether obvious AI shots exist in recent commercial work.
items.description: Billy Boman shared a LinkedIn post and asked: "Me too! But...is there actually any 'obvious' AI here? as in full AI shots? I couldn't spot any..." Jordan Daniel Chesney responded: "I was wondering the same." Pierre Zandrowicz clarified: "Not AI." Jordan humorously noted: "How funny that we're now saying Not AI. Sorry, I thought it was AI. My mistake. Still a great ad."

items.title: üé¨ Celebrities and AI Warnings
items.overview: Discussion on celebrity warnings about AI and future relevance.
items.description: Jordan Daniel Chesney shared a post: "Celebrities should pontificate their warnings and ideals while they're still relevant cause soon enough, few will listen." Stephan Bugaj countered: "Very unlikely. I've heard this claim since the Synthespians of the Thalmanns, and while that work was too little too early ‚Äî people still ultimately want to connect with other people. Some of those people will likely be new AI Creator celebrities, the Parker & Stones and Nolans of the medium, but there will still be humans that other humans have parasocial relationships with as long as there are humans." Jordan responded: "Good point. We will always suffer fools simply because they're human." Aaron Bhugobaun added: "Not sure if its going to break new ground or be unique enough. but, is anyone going to tell him about the AI that is being developed and used at Netflix."

items.title: üé¨ FOMO and Keeping Up with Tools
items.overview: Blair expresses universal creator challenge.
items.description: Blair shared: "I'm reminded when I stop by here (when i get a chance) that I don't even know how up to date (or seriously lacking I am) with all the tools cause I'm head down busy all the time. A bit of fomo happening. Anyone else feel this?" Justin Hackney responded: "Always. And yet we're all surfing the wave."

items.title: üé¨ Grok Image and Video Generation
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney showcases Grok's capabilities.
items.description: Jordan shared: "This is Grok images and video gens. Pretty powerful for action, if you ask me." Tom Furse responded: "That's slaps." BasvdE called it "the best I've seen so far." Jordan confirmed: "Crazy, right?!"

items.title: üé¨ Curious Refuge Time & Cost Breakdown
items.overview: Winston Mayo highlights valuable production analysis.
items.description: Winston Mayo shared: "This time and cost breakdown in AI from curious refuge is fantastic." The video provides detailed analysis of production timelines and budgets for AI filmmaking.

items.title: üé® Neocept Design Style
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney discovers compelling visual style.
items.description: Jordan shared: "Wow, I'm really digging this style." Sami agreed: "pretty dope!" Jordan added: "Crazy, cool, right?! I'd love to see a whole story in this style. This guy's worth a follow over on X."

items.title: üéÆ Kling 01 Elements Complete Workflow
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney provides step-by-step guide for the breakthrough workflow.

tutorial.steps:
1. Go to Kling 01
2. Select 'Elements'
3. Build your micro-LoRAs (Elements) = 4 images per LoRA
4. Add images (up to 6)
5. Reference your elements (LoRAs) and images with @ references
6. Choose between 3-10 seconds (1080p)
tutorial.key_insight: *Not a START and END frame tool - feed it 4 images for the shot, plus character Elements (LoRAs). Use upwards to 30 images to create 1 shot. The more images you feed the better.*
tutorial.why_it_works: *Coupled with NBP, you can now block exactly where the camera goes, exactly what multiple subjects do, where they stand, how they act, and control hundreds of details within your room/scene, with total consistency.*

items.title: üé® Topaz Proteus Optimal Settings
items.overview: Billy Boman shares his production-tested Proteus configuration.

tutorial.settings: *Proteus for all-around use. Recovery detail to zero. Change from automatic to manual analysis for clips and then hit estimate - zero sharpen and improve detail.*
tutorial.why_these_settings: *Provides clean upscaling without over-sharpening or adding unwanted detail enhancement.*

items.title: üé¨ Topaz Astra for Motion Artifacts
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney shares technique for fixing morphing issues.

tutorial.technique: *Use Topaz Astra Precise to re-generate in upscale. As long as you can roto sections, like characters faces, this workflow saves 50% of the low quality motion artifacts.*
tutorial.advanced_workflow: *Manually roto in After Effects with multiple upscalers: 1 level of generative upscale for backgrounds, 1 for elements/logos, and 1 for faces. Would pay $100 a clip if Topaz automated this with SMART ROTO/COMPOSITION.*

items.title: üé® Topaz Astra for Closeups
items.overview: Edmond Yang shares Astra workflow with limitations.

tutorial.use_case: *Astra for closeups is pretty good, but hallucinates with small objects.*
tutorial.workaround: *Crop in and upscale and put back again. Need to upscale clip by clip since there's some ghosting between shots, at least 1-2 frames.*

items.title: üé¨ Logo Consistency: First & Last Frame Technique
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney shares critical commercial workflow.

tutorial.technique: *Do FIRST frame and LAST frame to hold logos together. With the logos consistent together in both frames Kling does an amazing job of holding them throughout.*
tutorial.production_reality: *Did a few fashion commercials and had to do FIRST and LAST frame for every single shot, no exceptions.*

items.title: üì∏ Camera & Lens Prompting from IMDb Tech Specs
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney reveals professional cinematography research method.

tutorial.workflow:
1. Go to IMDb
2. Search for a film that had the look you love
3. Check the Tech Specs
4. Lots of the time, lenses, film stock, cameras etc. are listed out
tutorial.example: *Taxi Driver tech specs provide authentic camera and lens information for prompting.*

items.title: üé® 3x3 Nano Banana Grid Prompt Formula
items.overview: Martin LeBlanc shares Higgsfield's production prompt.

tutorial.base_prompt: *"Generate a cohesive 3√ó3 grid 'Cinematic Contact Sheet' featuring 9 distinct camera shots of exactly these subjects in the same environment. You must adapt the standard cinematic shot types to fit the content (e.g., if a group, keep the group together; if an object, frame the whole object): [List each shot here]"*
tutorial.extraction_prompt: *Use LLM to generate extraction prompt with hard constraints: Do not change composition, framing, camera angle, or perspective. Do not add, remove, or modify any characters, props, objects, or background elements. Clean up artifacts, sharpen details, improve resolution and texture quality.*
tutorial.optimization: *Better in 16:9 instead of 1:1 to get closer to final shot. Sometimes prompt very different camera angles for exploring.*

items.title: üé¨ Kling Multiple Characters Lip Sync
items.overview: Edmond Yang explains selective animation technique.

tutorial.problem: *Having multiple people in a shot but only wanting one person to speak/move.*
tutorial.solution: *Isolate and combine in post - basically having two shots: non-speaking and speaking. In Kling lip-sync you can actually choose who is speaking (need a pre-gen video).*

items.title: üéÆ Kling 01 Elements for Multiple Characters
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney provides advanced multi-character workflow.

tutorial.workflow: *Create multiple micro LoRAs of each person (as Elements) and then upload up to 6 images for your scene blocking.*
tutorial.advanced_technique: *Use Kling 01 with Elements for precise control over multiple subjects, their positions, actions, and interactions.*

items.title: üé¨ Timelapse Clock Workarounds
items.overview: Rory Flynn and Justin Hackney share solutions for the clock challenge.

tutorial.successful_models: *WAN 2.6 and Kling keyframes in 01 have had success.*
tutorial.techniques: *Try 'hyperlapse' as well as 'timelapse' in prompts. Use keyframe with radial blur of the timelapse effect as the end frame. Or do frame-to-frame + single image generations, reducing frame rate.*
tutorial.fallback: *After Effects for manual control when AI fails.*

items.title: üé® Freepik NBP Workaround During Slowness
items.overview: Billy Boman shares technique for better results during outages.

tutorial.workaround: *Use 'Cinematic Live Action prompting' + references to work around quality issues.*
tutorial.caveat: *Absolutely sometimes it goes into old Imagen vibes in the worst way.*

items.title: üé® Freepik Split Grid Feature
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney demonstrates new grid workflow.

tutorial.feature: *Freepik has a Split Grid button and it does exactly what you think it does.*
tutorial.use_case: *Generate grids and split them for individual panel extraction and upscaling.*

items.title: üé® DorLabs Grid Workflow
items.overview: Yonatan Dor brothers previews comprehensive grid system.

tutorial.capabilities: *Create grids based on image refs, get prompt suggestions based on input, extract any panel + upscale & optional modification in 1 step. Toggle characters & locations on/off at any step. Feed it a script, ref image, or one sentence.*

items.title: üé¨ LTX Audio-to-Video Workflow
items.overview: Ari kuschnir demonstrates music video application.

tutorial.workflow: *Use LTX audio-to-video for lip-sync, combine with Kling Motion Control and Runway 4.5 for complete music video production.*
tutorial.use_case: *Created music video remake using this multi-tool approach.*

items.title: üé® T-Pose and Y-Pose for Action Shots
items.overview: Blvckl!ght shares character positioning technique.

tutorial.technique: *Use 'T pose' and 'Y pose' prompts for action shots. Add 'motion blur' for mid-action shots.*
tutorial.advanced_use: *Super useful for all the wides because then you can in-paint other parts of the scene.*

items.title: üé¨ Runway 4.5 Multi-Shot Sequences
items.overview: Marco demonstrates improved capabilities.

tutorial.improvements: *Dramatically improved running physics. Multi-shot sequences work well.*
tutorial.remaining_challenge: *Logos still need FIRST and LAST frame technique for consistency.*

items.title: üé® Higgsfield Camera & Lens UI
items.overview: Edmond Yang and Martin LeBlanc discuss reverse engineering.

tutorial.observation: *Higgsfield has nice camera and lens UI that's just prompts with no post-processing or tricks.*
tutorial.approach: *Should be possible to reverse engineer the prompt structure.*

items.title: üé¨ Creatify Aurora Lip Sync
items.overview: PJ Accetturo asks about new lip-sync option.

tutorial.tool: *Creatify Aurora for lip sync with audio.*
tutorial.comparison: *LTX is really powerful. Problem with most lip-sync models: camera is always completely static. Veo remained king for so long because moving camera helped get past uncanny speaking.*

items.title: üé¨ Kling Lip Sync on Pre-Gen Videos
items.overview: Edmond Yang confirms Kling's lip-sync quality.

tutorial.assessment: *The lip-sync at Kling is pretty decent on videos.*
tutorial.workflow: *Use on pre-generated video content for best results.*

items.title: üé® Gabe Michael B-Roll Grid Space
items.overview: Gabe Michael shares alternative grid workflow.

tutorial.feature: *Created one for b-roll that does similar thing but without losing quality on the grid.*
tutorial.access: *Shared Freepik Space link for community use.*

items.overview: Edmond Yang shares new AI agent discovery.

tutorial.tool: *Moltbot (previously Clawdbot) - crazy tech for AI automation.*
tutorial.teaser: *Working on new game project using the technology.*

items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney shares training resource.

tutorial.focus: *AI Music Videos 101: Creative decisions that turn sound into cinematic emotion. Not about tools‚Äîabout vision, timing, and taste.*

items.title: üé® D4RT - 4D Scene Understanding
items.overview: Justin Hackney highlights Google DeepMind breakthrough.

tutorial.technology: *D4RT: Teaching AI to see the world in four dimensions.*

items.title: üé¨ Lasso Tool for Video Matting
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney shares rotoscoping tool.

tutorial.tool: *Lasso tool for video matting and styleframe work.*

items.title: üé® Gaussian Splatting Music Video Workflow
items.overview: Billy Boman showcases advanced 3D technique.

tutorial.example: *Christopher Rutledge music video using Gaussian Splatting.*

items.title: üé¨ OpenWork AI Platform
items.overview: Matthieu shares new AI work platform.

items.title: üé¨ Arthur Chance - Giggs Music Video
items.description: Arthur Chance shared a new film for artist Giggs, made in Veo 2 & 3.1, Nano Banana Pro, Gemini and AI Studio. The exciting development was creating "an AI ethnographic researcher to act like an archive producer - giving the film a level of authenticity that only a local or academic would know. The artist was happy and surprised by the level of cultural minutia. Very wild." Tom Furse responded: "Lil rapper called Giggs" with shock emoji, recognizing the major UK artist.

items.title: üé¨ Ari kuschnir - Music Video Remake
items.description: Ari kuschnir shared: "Here's my new one, woke up with it in my head a few days ago and the LTX audio to video came out the next day so I could do it. Also used Kling Motion Control and a few shots add the end with the new Runway 4.5 (inside car)." Linus Ekenstam called it "epic" and suggested adding captions, but Ari noted he "wanted to stay true to the original."

items.title: üé¨ Yonatan Dor brothers - Political Commentary
items.description: Yonatan Dor brothers shared a heavy political piece with warning. PJ Accetturo responded: "holy shit that's heavy. it really goes to show how ignorant these dumbasses are and how good we have it today." Ryan Phillips said: "Hits like an atom bomb. Powerful stuff." Harvey disagreed with the approach, but Yonatan explained: "Grew up in israel with Holocaust survivors, they'd approve. Thank you for the thought!" Blvckl!ght said: "You won me over with this one. Very poignant. Well done." Billy Boman called it "Exceptional contemporary socio-political commentary that hits harder than usual." Justin Hackney simply said: "Phenomenal."

items.title: üé¨ Liam - Hat Trick Productions BTS Documentary
items.description: Liam announced a major moment for Hat Trick Productions with a BTS documentary showcasing AI adoption by a major UK legacy TV/Film player. He emphasized the doc is "deliberately honest about creativity with AI - the good and the not so good." Yigit praised: "Love it Liam! Beautifully shot and edited." Ryan Phillips noted: "Hat trick are a great company to have as a partner pushing AI forward." Liam thanked Yigit for "all the support and hard work" and for cooking together.

items.title: üé¨ Linus Ekenstam - Life Advice Video
items.description: Linus Ekenstam shared: "Not AI, but just a way to live your life better each day. Thanks @Justin Hackney for having me in here, I'm learning so much from everyone daily."

items.title: üé¨ Max - Real-Time Editing Demo
items.description: Max demonstrated real-time editing capabilities, showcasing the speed of modern AI-assisted workflows.

items.title: üé¨ Edmond Yang - Reaction Video
items.description: Edmond Yang shared: "This was fun to have a reaction video for" showcasing community engagement with AI content.

items.title: üé¨ Albert Bozesan - Banana Slugs Pitch Deck
items.description: Albert Bozesan shared: "I'm teaching pitch decks in the Curious Refuge course refresher, the example project is an animated adventure about Banana Slugs. Pretty proud of this pun" with image showing the project.

items.title: üé¨ Ryan Phillips - Kling Motion Control Demo
items.description: Alex praised: "Best use of Kling motion I've seen so far. Incredible work, mate." Ryan Phillips responded: "Cheers Alex Mate."

items.title: üé¨ Justin Hackney - Parliament Visit
items.description: Justin Hackney shared: "Somehow Parliament let me through security today. Honoured to be invited into conversations about the good, the bad, and the genuinely spicy shifts unfolding right now... When I spoke on Realdreams - I welled up a little inside - Such savants, innovators, and creative forces within this community, I felt genuinely humbled to be part of it. Grateful, grounded, and unlocked for what comes next." BasvdE responded: "Happy to see you make such an impact for us all @Justin Hackney keep up the good work." Blvckl!ght humorously edited the photo to fix Justin's height, and Jordan Daniel Chesney created face-swapped versions.

items.title: üéµ Tom Furse - OG Generative Culture Pioneer
items.overview: Justin Hackney welcomes Tom Furse, describing him as having "OG early GAN energy."
items.description: Justin Hackney introduced Tom Furse: "New dreamer alert. Tom Furse. OG early GAN energy. Deep in the roots of generative culture, shaping sound and systems before it was mainstream. A true original riding the wave from the very beginning. Long overdue Tom." Martin LeBlanc, Ryan Phillips, Billy Boman, Ludovic, KƒìkƒÅ, BasvdE, Rory Flynn, and Jim Phillips all welcomed him warmly. Tom responded: "Thanks @Justin Hackney and hello everyone!"

items.title: üé¨ Jeremy Boxer - Festival Architect & Creative Director
items.overview: Justin Hackney welcomes Jeremy Boxer, describing him as "one of those rare humans who's been quietly shaping the future of creative culture for decades."
items.description: Justin Hackney introduced Jeremy Boxer: "A Creative Director, Filmmaker, Curator, and Festival Architect who's held major roles at Vimeo where he co created the Vimeo Festival + Awards and Vimeo On Demand, RES / RESFEST, Tribeca Enterprises, S√≥nar + D, CogX, and the British Film Institute. He's worked alongside and programmed for Sundance, SXSW, Marche du Film, Burning Man, Panasonic, Warner Bros, PlayStation and more, always pushing the edge of what storytelling can become when technology actually serves human emotion, meaning, and connection. Right now Jeremy is producing and co writing the feature film How I Faked My Life with AI, which premiered at Tribeca and is now seeking distribution. At his core, Jeremy's mission is simple and powerful: Using technology as a gateway to deeper human experience, not as a distraction but as a bridge - this guy is fucking OG and has surfed the wave a few times." Ryan Phillips, Tom Furse, Jordan Daniel Chesney, Benny, KƒìkƒÅ, Blvckl!ght, BasvdE, Rourke, MetaPuppet, Jagger, and Blair all welcomed him. Jeremy responded: "Thanks for the warm welcome @Justin Hackney delighted to be here with you all! Nice to see so many familiar faces." Pierre Zandrowicz asked if he'll be at Artefact Film Festival in Paris, and Jeremy said "There is a chance I may be."

items.title: üöÄ James McAulay - Wonder Studios Head of Growth
items.overview: Justin Hackney welcomes James McAulay, who led Creator Growth at ElevenLabs and just joined Wonder Studios.
items.description: Justin Hackney introduced James McAulay: "James led Creator Growth at ElevenLabs during a breakout year and has just joined Wonder Studios to lead growth there as well. He's right at the intersection of creators, platforms, and the next phase of how this ecosystem scales. This is someone who understands momentum, distribution, and how real creator communities actually compound over time. No theory, just execution and taste - elite addition to the wonder team as head of growth. If you're building, scaling, or thinking seriously about where creator tech is heading, James is absolutely someone to connect with. Big addition to the room. And to the wonder team. Let's go." Billy Boman, BasvdE, KƒìkƒÅ, Blair, Ryan Phillips, and Rourke all welcomed him. James responded: "Thanks for the warm welcome, Justin! I've heard so many incredible stories about Realdreams from various members and friends over the last year. Feel privileged to be here joining the inner circle. Exciting plans are in motion for the Wonder Community and for Realdreams. Watch this space..." He also tested the 3x3 grid prompt and asked about mobile app features.

items.title: üé¨ Freepik CPP Credits Issue Resolution
items.overview: Community experiences temporary Freepik CPP credits issue.
items.description: Albert Bozesan reported losing access to Freepik CPP credits, noting "they're just taking some time refreshing monthly credits. was a bit of a rude awakening this morning, I wanted to record a bunch of tuts and suddenly had no access." He explained "I'm pretty sure they're still manually reapproving CPP members every month." The latest news was "there's an issue with the coupons, and we're working on it." Andy Mc clarified: "9th Jan is the refresh date this month for Freepik CP creds - Angela mentioned they'd bumped up more last month as they'd be refreshing a bit later this month." Edmond Yang shared: "I got scared i was kicked out on the ccp, so i mailed Angela, so they said it was an internal error, and should've gone automatically." Martin LeBlanc later confirmed: "There was a bug with the credits for Freepik CPP. Should be fixed now."

items.title: üé¨ Lighthouse Live 2026 with Cool Blonde Swedish Dude
items.overview: Luka T announces Lighthouse Live 2026 opening.
items.description: Luka T announced: "We're opening Lighthouse Live 2026 with the one and only - Cool Blonde Swedish Dude!!! Ya'll know who this is" with video. Later he announced: "We all know this legend and I'm sitting down with him next week. Join @MetaPuppet and me on next Lighthouse Live!" Billy Boman highlighted the quote: "'Taste is the only weapon that scales' is a sick quote!" Justin Hackney agreed: "Printing this on swag asap."

items.title: üé¨ Sloperator Term Coining
items.overview: Community playfully coins new terms for AI operators.
items.description: Martin LeBlanc asked: "can we get some support for 'sloperator'?" Billy Boman suggested "'Slopgineer'? Doesn't have the same ring to it..." Edmond Yang added: "The Smoooooth sloperatooooooor. I know you have the song in your head now." Tom Furse contributed "Sloptomystic" and "Sloptomist." Billy Boman offered "'Sloptologist' - Be right back honey, just a quick visit to the Sloptologer in the morning!" Tom Furse concluded: "It's a messy job but someone's got to do it." Andreas Massouras added: "'Promptstitute' has a nice ring to it too." Martin LeBlanc declared it "my favorite."

items.title: üé¨ Fal's Qwen ComfyUI Node with Camera Control
items.overview: Alex highlights major Qwen advancement.
items.description: Alex shared: "Fal's new lora for Qwen is absolutely amazing guys. And now we have a Comfy node to place the camera exactly where we want." Billy Boman asked: "Nice - so in essence local workflow but with need for a Fal API key to access?" Alex clarified: "You can install the nodes and run the models locally. No API needed."

items.title: üé¨ Sirios LUT AI Tool
items.overview: Sultan asks about new color grading tool.
items.description: Sultan asked: "Anyone early tested Sirios new Lut AI tool?" No responses captured in this digest period.

items.title: üé¨ DeepSeek IPO Success
items.overview: Community discusses DeepSeek's market performance.
items.description: PJ Accetturo shared an image from Theoretically Tim's newsletter about DeepSeek's IPO. Sultan responded: "Looks serious! Good for them!" Winston Mayo noted: "If it holds that's really great. Day 1 ipos usually surge up but then come down."

items.title: üé¨ Oscars AI Rules Update
items.overview: Community analyzes new Academy rules on AI.
items.description: Henry asked for takes on the new rules. Tom Furse analyzed: "I was expecting a more expanded statement but that's all it says about AI in the rules change. Looks like they're saying 'we're open to AI submissions but we might ask you about them' but using a stern tone that placates the anxieties around AI in the industry." Henry agreed: "Yeah, kinda getting the same...We're not closing the door but we'll hold you accountable for its usage." Tom wondered: "'Reserves the right to inquire' - I wonder what questions they'd even ask?" Rory Flynn joked: "Would be funny if it was in like 90% of the submissions." Andy Mc noted: "Even more confusing is that ML has been used in high-end VFX workflows to some degree for a good 10-15 years - probably longer. Lots of confusion with clients/studios about the difference between ML and Generative AI."

items.title: üé¨ The Seeker Screening at MASSIVE STUDIOS
items.overview: Stephan Bugaj announces LA screening.
items.description: Stephan Bugaj shared: "Our friends at MASSIVE STUDIOS will be showing my film The Seeker this SUNDAY Jan 11th as part of their THE PROMPT variety show of exploration. If you're in the LA area and want to meet some interesting AI filmmakers and/or you missed the other LA screening of The Seeker and want to see it with a group, come join."

items.title: üé¨ PJ Accetturo's Rant
items.overview: PJ Accetturo shares thoughts on AI landscape.
items.description: PJ Accetturo posted: "Forgive my rant:" with link to his X post discussing the current state of AI and creative work.

items.title: üé¨ Chroma Awards Viewing Platform Launch
items.overview: Matty announces new viewing platform.
items.description: Matty shared: "Check out the winners from the Chroma Awards on our new viewing platform!" Winston Mayo responded: "This looks amazing." Henry and Ryan Phillips reported it doesn't work for them, and Matty said: "Thanks! Will let the developer know."

items.title: üé¨ Minimax Connection Request
items.overview: Justin Hackney seeks Minimax contact.
items.description: Justin Hackney asked: "Anyone here got a connection with minimax?" Ryan Phillips responded: "Yup what's up?" Justin replied: "Rocking up in your dms."

items.title: üé¨ Upscale LA Meetup
items.overview: Community members coordinate LA event attendance.
items.description: Matty asked: "Anyone headed to Upscale LA next week? I'll be there if anyone wanted meet up!" Jagger responded: "I'll be presenting! See you there." paula vivas confirmed: "@Martin LeBlanc and I will be there, for sure!" Martin LeBlanc added: "See you there!" Jordan Daniel Chesney suggested: "If you can head up to San Fran the week after I'd love to meet up! I'll be there Feb 1st and 2nd."

items.title: üé¨ TikTok Gift Cards Trade
items.overview: Winston Mayo offers gift card exchange.
items.description: Winston Mayo shared: "Hey TikTok gave me 2 go gift gift cards and I want the cash. If yall like the stores on the site I'll trade you the cash for cards. It's 300. They have alot of stores: apple, nike, restaurants etc."

items.title: üé¨ Chroma Awards Poster Designer Wanted
items.overview: Matty seeks collage poster designer.
items.description: Matty asked: "Is anyone great at designing movie posters or could recommend a designer? We are looking for someone who could make a collage for the Chroma Awards like this EEAAO poster."

items.title: üé¨ Artist List NYC Event Weather Warning
items.overview: Rory Flynn warns NYC visitors about January weather.
items.description: Rory Flynn joked: "I'm happy all the dreamers coming to nyc for the artist list event get the full NYC in January experience haha. Bring your coats." Rourke responded: "Just landed @Rory Flynn, I think Chris first and Chris branch are out right now!" Rory said: "I'll see you guys tomorrow."
